abilities.name: Ancient Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Aerodactyl is your Active Pokémon, you may ignore all Poké-Bodies until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Aerodactyl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Energy Jump
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energy Recharge
abilities.text: When you play Arcanine from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to Arcanine.

attacks.name: Shake
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: White Flames
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine.

abilities.name: Water Immunity
abilities.text: You can't attach Water Energy cards from your hand to Articuno.

attacks.name: Freeze Solid
attacks.text: If there are any Water Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Articuno.

attacks.name: Ice Cyclone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Pokémon in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Venom Spray
abilities.text: When you play Beedrill from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Rush
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. If you get 1 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If you get 2 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If you get 3 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage. If you get 4 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 90 more damage.

abilities.name: Carry Off
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, or Evolution cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Crobat is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Cross
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. If both of them are tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Freeze Lock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Active Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Crushing Ice
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost. Damage is calculated using the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost after applying effects to the Retreat Cost.

abilities.name: Self-healing
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Flareon, remove all Special Conditions affecting Flareon.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burn Booster
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Flareon in order to use this attack. If the discarded card is a Fire Energy card, this attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Spinning Blow
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If both coins are heads, switch Forretress with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scatterbomb
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, do 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. For each tails, do 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Manipulate
abilities.text: When you play Gengar from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may put a Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydrokinesis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Flame Vapor
abilities.text: When you play Gyarados from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon's Vengeance
attacks.text: If Gyarados has 7 or more damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 100.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Lonely Fang
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 20 damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon minus the number of your Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 3 Benched Pokémon and you have 1, this attack will do 30 damage plus 40 more damage.)

abilities.name: Self-healing
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Jolteon, remove all Special Conditions affecting Jolteon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderspark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon with at least 1 Energy card attached to it (yours and your opponent's).

abilities.name: Primal Aura
abilities.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, neither player can play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pollen Shield
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Ledian can't become affected by a Special Condition. (Any other effects of attacks, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, and Trainer cards still happen.)

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Immunity
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks done to Machamp.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discard the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Fire Stream
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo in order to use this attack. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Streaming Mantle
abilities.text: When you play Magcargo from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck and and then shuffle 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck. If you do, your opponent does the same.

attacks.name: Crushing Lava
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire or Fighting basic Energy card attached to Magcargo. If you discard a Fire Energy card in this way, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If you discard a Fighting Energy card in this way, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Attract Energy
abilities.text: When you play Magneton from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your other Pokémon to Magneton.

attacks.name: Electric Blast
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Magneton when you use this attack. If you do, put damage counters equal to the amount of Energy cards removed in this way on any number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon in the way you like. (For example, if you discard 3 Lightning Energy cards, you can put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and 2 on another.)

attacks.name: Bounce Off
attacks.text: If Magneton and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, the player controlling the Active Pokémon with the fewest number of Energy cards attached to it switches 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon minus the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 1 Benched Pokémon and you have 3, this attack will do 30 damage plus 20 more damage.)

abilities.name: Fire Immunity
abilities.text: You can't attach Fire Energy cards from your hand to Moltres.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Moltres.

attacks.name: Burning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Moltres.

abilities.name: Evolution Helper
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoqueen is on your Bench, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from your Active Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads

abilities.name: Primal Stare
abilities.text: As long as Omastar is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spook
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sudden Growth
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to Politoed.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Splash
attacks.text: Move 2 Water Energy cards attached to Politoed to 1 or 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You may put both on the same Pokémon or 1 each on 2 different Pokémon.) If you have no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

abilities.name: Strange Spiral
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Poliwrath is your Active Pokémon, you may discard a basic Energy card attached to Poliwrath. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. This power can't be used if Poliwrath is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Zzzap
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokémon with a Poké-Body or Poké-Power (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance.)

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on Raichu.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, you must discard an Energy card attached to Raikou. (Attach the Lightning Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Raikou.)

attacks.name: Lightning Sphere
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raikou. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy attached to Starmie and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Star Back
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Rare Metal
abilities.text: All basic Energy cards attached to Steelix provide Metal Energy instead of their usual types.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Metal Tail
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Dark Gaze
abilities.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon, Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) can't use Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Self-healing
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Vaporeon, remove all Special Conditions affecting Vaporeon.

attacks.name: Hypnosplash
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Aqua Trick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and move it to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

abilities.name: Good Neighbor
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Wigglytuff is on your bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, each player removes up to 2 damage counters from his or her Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if you have already used another Wigglytuff's Good Neighbor Poké-Power this turn.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon you have in play.

abilities.name: Synchronicity
abilities.text: You may attach any Technical Machine to Xatu.

attacks.name: Warp Hole
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card from your discard pile and put it on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy card in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Electrode.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Electrode does 100 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Thick Shell
abilities.text: All damage done by attacks to Kabuto from Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Machoke's Mega Punch attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Gift of Spite
attacks.text: Count the number of your Pokémon in play with damage counters on them. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Investigate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of any player's deck or at up to 2 of any player's Prizes. Put any cards you looked at back in the same order. This power can't be used if Noctowl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Water of Evolution
attacks.text: Put an Omastar from your hand onto Omanyte. This counts as evolving Omanyte.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. You opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Continuous Charge
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads. Put a damage counter on Piloswine for each heads.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Starmie but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Core Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Mirror Coat
abilities.text: If Wobbuffet becomes Poisoned or Burned by the Defending Pokémon's attack during your opponent's turn, the Defending Pokémon becomes affected by the same Special Condition.

attacks.name: Return Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either is heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Wobbuffet.

abilities.name: Psychoflow
abilities.text: As long as there is a Psychic Energy card attached to Abra, its Retreat Cost is 0.

abilities.name: Reconstruction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a basic Energy card in your hand, you may search your deck for an Omanyte or Kabuto card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then put a basic Energy card from your hand into your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Energy Recycle
attacks.text: Shuffle a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Limited Delivery
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Technical Machine or Pokémon Tool card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done by attacks to Diglett during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

abilities.name: Prismatic Body
abilities.text: Each basic Energy card attached to Ditto provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Ditto doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.)

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done by attacks to Dugtrio during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness or Resistance. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

abilities.name: Slippery Skin
abilities.text: As long as the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, Dunsparce's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Eevee does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leek Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: All damage done by attacks to Forretress is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shell Rupture
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put a damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Patch
attacks.text: Take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Syncroblast
attacks.text: If Girafarig and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 40.

attacks.name: Sharp Stinger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Sound Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Strength in Numbers
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Zubat, Golbat, and Crobat on your Bench.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Shadow Hand
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 cards from your hand. If you do, draw that many cards.

attacks.name: Angry Horn
attacks.text: If there are 4 or more damage counters on Heracross, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 30.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Houndour.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndour.

attacks.name: Energy Heal
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon with an Energy card attached to it. Remove 1 damage counter from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: All damage by attacks to Kakuna is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Assist
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Ledyba by attacks is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Magikarp, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and move it to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Sudden Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Energy cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Evil Eye
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Put a damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has a damage counter on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card named Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Max Voltage
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Pikachu. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Pineco does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Sleep Bubble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Twiddle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Continuous Bite
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If you get 1 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If you get 2 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. If you get 3 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon or Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Rhyhorn.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Sand Trap
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 2 of them. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Needle Rush
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get at least 1 heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Vase Body
abilities.text: All damage done by attacks to Shuckle is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Poisonous Saliva
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Spinning Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch Skarmory with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Lava
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Slugma in order to use this attack. The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Lolling About
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, you may remove 1 damage counter from Snorlax. Snorlax is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, until the end of your opponent's next turn the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat.

attacks.name: Threaten
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Antler Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon (don't apply Weakness or Resistance). If tails and your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Energy Healing
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Staryu for each Energy attached to it. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Plant
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: If there are any damage counters on Sunkern, remove 1 of them.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Teddiursa.

attacks.name: Bear Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If not, this attack does 40 damage.

attacks.name: Healing Dust
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If a Pokémon has fewer damage counters than the number of heads, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition (Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned). The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Magnetic Pull
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spin Tackle
attacks.text: Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Entangling Thread
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Yanma.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Sound Waves
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Flitter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Ancient Ruins
rules: Once during each player's turn (before he or she attacks), if he or she has not played a Supporter card, that player may reveal his or her hand to his or her opponent. If that player reveals his or her hand and there is no Supporter card there, that player draws a card.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Relic Hunter
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter and/or Stadium cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Apricorn Maker
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Crystal Shard
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's type (color) is Colorless. If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

name: Desert Shaman
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck and draw up to 4 cards. Your opponent does the same.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Fast Ball
rules: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal an Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal an Evolution card, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Fisherman
rules: Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Friend Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with the same type as 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Hyper Potion
rules: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 2 Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard 2 Energy from it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Lure Ball
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put an Evolution Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Miracle Sphere α

attacks.name: Fire Force
attacks.text: If the Pokémon using this attack has Fire and Lightning basic Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If the Pokémon using this attack has Fire and Fighting basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage and remove 3 damage counters from the Pokémon that Miracle Plate α is attached to. Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Evolved Fire, Lightning, or Fighting Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Miracle Plate α.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Miracle Sphere β

attacks.name: Freezing Force
attacks.text: If the Pokémon using this attack has Fire and Water basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If the Pokémon using this attack has Water and Psychic basic Energy cards attached to it, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Evolved Fire, Water, or Psychic Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Miracle Sphere β.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Miracle Sphere γ

attacks.name: Thunder Force
attacks.text: If the Pokémon using this attack has Grass and Lightning basic Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If the Pokémon using this attack has Water and Lightning basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage and lets you put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Evolved Grass, Water, or Lightning Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Miracle Sphere γ.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mirage Stadium
rules: Whenever a player tries to retreat a Pokémon during his or her turn, that player flips a coin. If heads, that player retreats that Pokémon (and discards Energy normally). If tails, that Pokémon can't retreat this turn (the player doesn't discard any Energy).
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Mystery Plate α

attacks.name: Desert Burn
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If your opponent has only 1 Prize, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Mystery Plate α.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mystery Plate β

attacks.name: Stone Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, draw 3 cards. If your opponent has only 1 Prize, choose 2 Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). Your opponent shuffles those cards into his or her deck. Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Mystery Plate β.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mystery Plate γ

attacks.name: Retro Cave
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, shuffle your hand into your deck and then draw 6 cards. If your opponent has exactly 2 Prizes, choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Your opponent puts the top card on that Evolved Pokémon on the bottom of his or her deck. (This counts as devolving that Pokémon.) Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Mystery Plate γ.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mystery Plate δ

attacks.name: Healing Oasis
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If your opponent has exactly 2 Prizes, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. Illustrated by Hiromichi Sugiyama More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Mystery Plate δ.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mystery Zone
rules: You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Oracle
rules: Choose 2 cards from your deck and shuffle the rest of your deck. Put the chosen cards on top of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Underground Expedition
rules: Look at the bottom 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Put the other cards back on the bottom of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Underground Lake
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put an Omanyte or a Kabuto card from his or her discard pile onto his or her Bench. (Cards put on the Bench this way are considered Basic Pokémon.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Bounce Energy
rules: This card provides ColorlessColorless Energy. You can attach this card to your Pokémon that has basic Energy cards attached to it. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon, return a basic Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand.

name: Cyclone Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to your Active Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Retro Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to 1 of your Evolved Pokémon, you may remove up to 2 damage counters from that Pokémon and discard the top card from it. (This counts as devolving it.)

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Grass, Water, or Psychic basic Energy card from your hand to Celebi, Celebi's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Empathic Healing
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Celebi and each Pokémon that's the same type (color) as Celebi.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Fire, Lightning, or Fighting basic Energy card from your hand to Charizard, Charizard's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Fireblast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Charizard.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Grass, Fire, or Psychic basic Energy card from your hand to Crobat, Crobat's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Poison Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Squared Attack
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Grass, Fire, or Fighting basic Energy card from your hand to Golem, Golem's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Earth Bomb
attacks.text: Golem does 20 damage to itself. This attack also does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Fire, Water, or Lightning basic Energy card from your hand to Ho-oh, Ho-oh's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Scalding Steam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Ho-oh and flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water, Lightning, or Fighting basic Energy card from your hand to Kabutops, Kabutops's type (color) becomes the same as that type of Energy until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Draining Cut
attacks.text: Remove a damage counter from Kabutops.

attacks.name: Triple Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
